pages.text: A typical redstone panel includes:$(li)Domain Selector: Chooses which property to control, matching the main panel's options.$(li)Aggregation Strategy:$(li2)Summation: Adds control values from multiple channels.$(li2)Exclusive: Only the latest active channel affects the value.$(li)Interpolation: Linear or nonlinear (finer control for weak signals).

$(li)Channels below the selector:$(li2)Direction Selector: Specifies input face for redstone signals.$(li2)Min/Max: Maps redstone strength (0-15) to target values. Values interpolate between min (0) and max (15).
For toggle domains (e.g., motor lock), min/max are hidden. Default behavior: 0 = off, non-zero = on.
